head.title: Add Image Watermark to {{FileformatUp}} in Java
head.description: Java library to add image watermark to {{FileformatUp}} file in Java & J2SE applications using GroupDocs.Watermark APIs for Java.

header.title: Add Image Watermark to {{FileformatUp}} using Java
header.description: Adding image watermark to {{FileformatUp}} file in Java & J2SE applications. Add BMP, PNG, GIF & JPEG image watermarks to the documents. Also manage the watermark size, alignment, rotation angle and position of the watermark on the document pages, as you may need.

about.title: GroupDocs.Watermark for Java API
about.content1: GroupDocs.Watermark for Java is a complete watermarks management solution for Java applications. Developers can quickly perform watermarks manipulation operations like; add, edit, search and delete different types of watermarks from within documents of all popular file formats. It supports working with text and image watermarks in a variety of documents including PDF, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Email and image formats.
about.content2: GroupDocs.Watermark APIs are well supported on all major operating systems and Java versions including J2SE 7.0 (1.7), J2SE 8.0 (1.8) and Java 10.

steps.title_left: Add Image Watermark to {{FileformatUp}} File via Java

content_left.description: makes it easy for Java developers to add image (BMP, PNG, GIF or JPEG) watermarks in their applications by implementing a few easy steps.
content_left.step_2: Use image watermark path as constructor parameter of **ImageWatermark** class.
content_left.step_3: Set watermark properties (size, alignment, color etc).
content_left.step_4: Add watermark to the watermarker and generate output document.

content_right.description: Before executing the code example below, please make sure that you have the following prerequisites installed on your system.
content_right.step_1: Operating Systems: Microsoft Windows, Linux, MacOS
content_right.step_2: Development Environments: NetBeans, IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse
content_right.step_4: Download the latest version of GroupDocs.Watermark for Java from

example.coment3: Use image watermark path as constructor parameter of ImageWatermark class
example.coment5: Add watermark to the watermarker and generate output document
